BatteryManager.summary: The BatteryManager interface of the {{domxref("Battery Status API", "", "", "nocode")}} provides information about the system's battery charge level. The method returns a promise that resolves with a BatteryManager interface.

remarks.para: Since Chrome 103, the BatteryManager interface of {{domxref("Battery Status API", "", "", "nocode")}} only expose to secure context.

BatteryManagerCharging.summary: The charging read-only property of the interface is a Boolean value indicating whether or not the device's battery is currently being charged. When its value changes, the event is fired.

remarks.para: If the battery is charging or the user agent is unable to report the battery status information, this value is true. Otherwise, it is false.

BatteryManagerChargingchange.summary: The chargingchange event of the interface is fired when the battery property is updated.

BatteryManagerChargingTime.summary:
The chargingTime read-only property of the interface indicates the amount of time, in seconds, that remain until the battery is fully charged, or 0 if the battery is already fully charged or the user agent is unable to report the battery status information.
If the battery is currently discharging, its value is .
When its value changes, the event is fired.

blockquote.para:
Even if the time returned is precise to the second,
browsers round them to a higher interval
(typically to the closest 15 minutes) for privacy reasons.

BatteryManagerChargingtimechange.summary: The chargingtimechange event of the interface is fired when the battery property is updated.

BatteryManagerDischargingTime.summary:
The dischargingTime read-only property of the interface indicates the amount of time, in seconds, that remains until the battery is fully discharged,
or if the battery is currently charging rather than discharging or the user agent is unable to report the battery status information.
When its value changes, the event is fired.

blockquote.para:
Even if the time returned is precise to the second, browsers round them to a higher
interval (typically to the closest 15 minutes) for privacy reasons.

BatteryManagerDischargingtimechange.summary: The dischargingtimechange event of the interface is fired when the battery property is updated.

BatteryManagerLevel.summary:
The level read-only property of the interface indicates the current battery charge level as a value between 0.0 and 1.0.
A value of 0.0 means the battery is empty and the system is about to be suspended.
A value of 1.0 means the battery is full or the user agent is unable to report the battery status information.
When its value changes, the event is fired.

BatteryManagerLevelchange.summary: The levelchange event of the interface is fired when the battery property is updated.
